Summary: The 3 West Club is located in a building that is part of the Republican National Women's Club. It is not a typical chain hotel.

The 414 Hotel is a converted townhouse with about 22 rooms, and is comprised of two buildings separated by a courtyard. It is a brownstone type of facade with appealing with a simple, attractive and welcoming lobby.

60 Thompson is a boutique hotel with a modern, minimalist design, dark wood accents, and a Thai-inspired aesthetic. The hotel features a stylish lobby with funky furniture, and rooms include details like leather wall tiles and marble bathrooms.

6 Columbus is a modern, boutique hotel with a retro 50's-60's design, contemporary minimalist-style rooms with artwork, and sleek decor featuring teak walls and faux fur-covered elevator walls. The hotel's design includes features like heated bathroom floors, Kiehl's or Fresh bath products, iPod docking stations, and platform beds with under-bed storage.

70 Park Avenue Hotel is located in an older building with art deco design, some rooms featuring views of the Empire State Building. Some reviewers noted the hotel has a funky vibe and unique architecture, but some hallways are narrow.

The Ace Hotel has a funky, garage-chic style with masculine decor, reclaimed furniture, industrial fin de siecle design, and prewar architectural elements. Rooms feature details such as guitars, record players, SMEG fridges, and unique art.

The Affinia 50 has a modern, boutique-y feel with a brushed aluminum, marble, and plexiglass waterfall in the lobby, and some reviewers noted it used to be an apartment building. The hotel has a water-wall and orchids in the lobby, and a club room on the second floor described as modern and bright.

The hotel is a tall, narrow building converted from apartments, with most rooms being suites that include a kitchenette. Some reviewers mention having great views of the Chrysler Building and East River from their rooms on higher floors.

The Affinia Gardens, formerly an apartment building, offers spacious suite-style rooms with full kitchens, with some rooms featuring balconies or patios. The hotel is described as having a modern, Zen-like decor.

The Affinia Manhattan has an older architectural style and a grand lobby, and some reviewers mention the beautiful, old elevators as well as its old fashioned-looking exterior. The hotel's architecture is also described as Art Deco, and as an apartment conversion.
The Affinia Shelburne, formerly the Shelburne Murray Hill, is a remodeled hotel with modern, chic interiors. Some reviewers mention Empire State Building views and rooftop bars with skyline views.
AKA United Nations offers modern apartments with full kitchens and up-to-date furnishings. The complex is new and modern throughout.

The Algonquin Hotel is a historic landmark known for its unique, old-world, European, and art deco architectural design, featuring cartoon wallpaper, dark wood paneling, and a lobby reminiscent of a private members club. Rooms feature bay windows, spotlessly clean decor, antique furniture, and marble steps, and the property includes features like the famous Round Table.
The Americana Inn is a low-rise building with a sparse lobby on the second floor. It has an institutional feel reminiscent of a college dorm, with a basic interior.
The Amsterdam Court Hotel has a European ambiance, a snappy little lobby, and an Art Deco style. It is located in an older building, and the rooms are modernly designed.
The Astor on the Park is in an old building, with some rooms recently refurbished in 2005 and decorated to a high standard. It is similar to many European hotels.

The Bedford Hotel is described as an older, "boutique" style hotel with some rooms recently renovated, but overall the hotel is described as being worn and in need of updating. Many rooms have kitchenettes, and some rooms have views of the Empire State Building.

The Beekman Tower is an Art Deco building with a rooftop bar offering great views of the city and river; the hotel was originally built for use by women's university sororities and the East Tower lobby has notable brickwork. Many reviewers mention that it is designed like a New York apartment and gives them the feel of living like a New Yorker.

The Belleclaire Hotel is located in a charming, historic building with architecture resembling urban apartments rather than traditional hotel rooms, and some rooms have rounded walls that form turret-like spaces. It is an older building, with some rooms renovated with modern decor and hardwood floors.

The Bentley Hotel has a modern, boutique-like interior with dark, minimalist decor and renovated rooms, with some rooms having a zebra print design. Its architecture is a converted office tower with a rooftop bar and restaurant.
The hotel is modern and stylish, with laminate-wood floors and flat-panel TVs. The rooms are newly renovated and have bathrooms tiled wall to wall in dark stone giving it a very modern feel.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention anything about the architectural design.

The Best Western Hospitality House is a converted apartment building, with suites that include kitchens, living rooms, and multiple bedrooms, giving the feeling of having a New York City apartment. Some reviews mention it is an older building with original hardwood floors.

The Best Western Seaport Inn is located in an old brick building in the South Street Seaport area, surrounded by small, old buildings with cobblestone streets. The decor features uninspired polyester curtains and veneer wood paneling.

The Blue Moon Hotel is a renovated eight-story historic tenement house with 22 rooms and meticulously restored woodwork, featuring artsy paintings, decorative floor tiles, and cozy seating areas in the lobby. Each room is named after a 1930s or 1940s celebrity and contains framed memorabilia pertaining to that celebrity.

Reviews mention that the Broadway Plaza Hotel may have been an office building transformed into a hotel, and that the lighting in some rooms includes office-style overhead fluorescent lighting. The entrance to the hotel is a narrow hallway.

The Buckingham Hotel features an artsy and unique entrance, a small and adorable lobby steeped in music, and rooms that are like entire one-bedroom NY City apartments. Some rooms have been renovated with fancy bathroom fixtures, while others are more like an ordinary nice New York apartment.
The Candlewood Suites is a high-rise building that is sandwiched between two other hotels. The common areas feel more like an apartment lobby than a hotel.

The Carlton Arms Hotel has a unique architectural design, with every room and hall being individually painted and decorated by different New York artists. The building is old and described as "rickety" or "funky", offering a one-of-a-kind experience.
The Carvi Hotel is located in a renovated former school building that was once owned by Madonna. The hotel has a small lobby and a single elevator serving 6 rooms per 8 floors.

The Casablanca Hotel has a Moroccan theme throughout, with North African motifs in the second-floor common room. Some reviewers describe it as Hollywood-like rather than strictly Moroccan and mention that the decor may seem slightly strange or quirky, but tasteful overall.

Chambers Hotel is a modern boutique hotel with industrial-chic design, art pieces in the hallways, and unique room features like drawing paper with color pencils. The lobby has a modern fireplace, and the rooms have industrial-style lighting, French windows, and concrete bathroom floors.

Chelsea Lodge is located in a converted brownstone with brownstone steps and brownstone building that features brownstone steps, brownstone building, quirky rooms, and old American country classic interior design. It is decorated with old pictures and a green painted bannister, and the rooms feature a olde worlde feel.

Chelsea Pines Inn is a converted 5-story brownstone with movie-themed rooms decorated with vintage posters and photos of movie stars. The hotel has a garden, greenhouse, and offers rooms with uniquely shaped layouts, some with glass block walls in the bathroom.
I am sorry, the reviews do not contain information about the architectural design of the hotel.

The City Club Hotel has an eclectic style, a trendy, modern, and masculine design with dark colors, mirrored walls, and unique features like TVs hidden behind mirrors. Some rooms are duplex suites with floor-to-ceiling windows and spiral staircases.
The Solita Soho is a small, modern, boutique hotel with a sleek interior design and swanky lighting in the lobby. It features flat-screen TVs in the rooms and marble bathrooms.

The hotel is in a historic-looking 20-story building that must've been an old office building, with wood finishes that were faded and varnish that had either peeled or gone. The room had high ceilings, was sleek, modern, and professionally decorated, and the furnishings were IKEA-like.
Club Quarters Midtown appears to be an older hotel that has been handsomely restored, with a Euro-sleek style. Rooms are small, and some rooms are off the stairwell.
The hotel features a modern, sleek European design with rooms in dark grey, blue, and green, and some rooms have 20+ foot ceilings. The hotel is described as unassuming from the street.

The hotel has a lobby with a beautifully-restored, tin ceiling, and some rooms have original crown molding; the building was formerly the Chinese owned Hotel Arlington. The breakfast room looks like it used to be a bar before the building became a Comfort Inn.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan is located in an older building with stained glass windows in the reception/bar area and an old-fashioned spiraling staircase and mason brick exterior. The hotel was formerly a 5-star hotel called the Gregorian.
The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is a new, 12-story, 60-room hotel that opened in 2008 and is located in Chinatown. Some rooms have views of the Manhattan Bridge and financial district.

The Comfort Inn Midtown is noted as an older building, with some mentions of recent renovations, and is described as a tall, narrow structure with a small elevator. The lobby is noted as having an "old school classy" feel.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention unique architectural design. The hotel is described as new, clean, and modern in appointments.

This hotel is described as a budget property in a building that may have previously been a housing project or budget apartment building. Some reviews mention renovations with fresh colors and clean bathrooms.

The hotel is described as a tall, skinny building squeezed between two buildings, resembling a match stick, with 20 floors and only 4 rooms per floor. The hotel's architecture is also described as modern in style and decor.

The Cooper Square Hotel features modern architecture and interiors with attention to detail, including a grand entrance and a library-style lobby. Rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows offering city views and bathrooms with unique designs like glass-tiled showers and claw-foot bathtubs.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is described as a nicely refurbished older hotel of humble character, originally built in the 1840's, with small, clean, and modern rooms. Some rooms are loft-style with high ceilings, while others have unusual layouts and brick wall views.

The hotel building is described as tall and narrow, sandwiched between two office buildings, with only 6-8 rooms per floor and a small entrance. Some reviewers mention renovated bathrooms with sliding doors, but others found these lacked privacy.
The Courtyard Marriott Upper East Side has a clean, modern lobby with plasma TVs and a clear glass wall overlooking the indoor pool. It is located near high-rise apartments and is not a skyscraper.
The Courtyard Marriott Fifth Avenue is located in a tall, narrow building. Some reviewers mention a recent renovation.
This Courtyard is in a renovated midtown Manhattan office building. It has a view of the Lipstick building.

The Crosby Street Hotel features a unique design with tall warehouse-style windows, individually designed rooms, and impressive oak-tree floors, with decor that is like being in a museum. The hotel is LEED-certified.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square is a 46-story hotel with corner rooms offering views of Times Square, the Hudson River, and the Empire State Building. The hotel has undergone recent renovations and features a modern, clean design.

The Da Vinci is described as a small, European-style hotel with a quaint lobby featuring marble and cherry wood. Some reviewers mention a historic feel, while others describe the decor as dated and basic.
The Doubletree Guest Suites is located in the heart of Times Square, but the lobby is on the 3rd floor. The hotel offers spacious two-room suites, but some reviewers mention dated decor.

The hotel is described as a tall and narrow building, modern and recently renovated, with some rooms offering views of the Empire State Building. Some reviewers noted the hotel looks like it was carved out from the side of a building and is located on a boring side street, while others mention it being a newer hotel.

The hotel has a modern and retro 60s decor, with remodelled rooms that include flat screen TVs. It is described as having a mid-century modern architecture with modern lobbies, narrowness, and comfort expected out of a Doubletree in NYC.

The Dream Hotel features a trendy and modern design with a unique Buddhist motif, blue neon lighting, and a lobby showcasing a large tropical fish tank. Some found the lobby to have an art deco style with gold thrones, fish tanks, and statues.
The Duane Street Hotel has a modern, stylish design with high ceilings, hardwood floors, and well-designed bathrooms. The lobby and restaurant are ultra-modern.

The Dylan Hotel is located in a building that used to be the Chemists Club, and some rooms feature chemistry-related decorations like beakers as drinking glasses. The hotel has a modern, boutique style, with spacious rooms featuring high ceilings.

The Eastgate Tower is a converted apartment building with large, clean rooms that include kitchenettes. The hotel's architecture is described as basic and dated, with some reviewers noting that the furniture and decor are worn.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not contain information about unique architectural design.

The Embassy Suites boasts a modern design with a soaring atrium, contemporary art, and offers skyline views, with its architecture described as an atrium-style hotel that seems a bit out of place in New York City. The hotel is a large structure built around an inner atrium where guests walk along open hallways overlooking the floor of the atrium.

The Empire Hotel features modern, trendy, and hip decor, particularly in the lobby, with a forest wallpaper design in the halls. Some reviewers mention unique design features such as wooden bath cabins and exposed steel beams.
The Envoy Club is located in an apartment building, with "hotel" units on floors 2-5, and offers spacious rooms, some with kitchens. It also features a rooftop deck with city views.
The hotel has a boutique feel with modern, large rooms and furniture. The bathroom is big and modern, and the hotel was tastefully appointed.

The Excelsior Hotel is an older hotel with a beautiful wood and marble lobby, elegant dark wood interior, and a quaint, traditional New York style. It has a European-style design, "country French" tile, French doors, and old-world charm.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not contain information about unique architectural design. However, the hotel is a new, modern property with a uniquely decorated breakfast room.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central has a European feel, with some rooms featuring canopied beds and Italian marble bathrooms, and the hotel is decorated with Irish memorabilia. The hotel has an Irish railway themed bar/grill, decked out with memorabilia from Ireland.
The Fitzpatrick Manhattan has art deco decor and recently renovated rooms with contemporary furnishings and walk-in showers. Some reviewers note that the hotel has an old-world charm.

The Flatotel has a modern, minimalist aesthetic with sleekly decorated rooms that some reviewers find stylish and trendy while others consider them cold and dark; some rooms feature unique layouts with separate toilet and shower rooms. The hotel, converted from a condominium, offers spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes and balconies, but some reviewers note that unrenovated rooms have dated decor and worn furniture.

The hotel is described as having a modern, industrial-chic decor with dark walls and modern furnishings. It is also described as a "hip" and "pseudo-boutique" hotel with "cool looking Europeans sitting around."
The hotel has new rooms with an industrial urban feel, with an attractive interior and exterior, modern decor, and a boutique-like style. Its exterior resembles a garage.
The hotel is recently remodeled with a minimalist approach to decorating and nice decor, and is built tall and skinny. Rooms feature a cool flatscreen tv on the wall.

The Four Seasons New York is noted for its architecture, designed by world-famous architect I.M. Pei, featuring a marble-look lobby with high ceilings and columns. The hotel's exterior has a light limestone cascade with lanterns at each corner.

Gild Hall has a unique decor described as a mix of an old-boy British club and Zen simplicity with quirky touches like a rhino footrest and antler chandeliers, and a modern/minimalist style with leather and dark woods. The hotel is also noted for its "modern hunting lodge chic" design.

The Gramercy Park Hotel features a unique, artsy modern design with dark, moody decor, touches of red leather, and artwork by artists like Schnabel and Basquiat. The hotel has different styles in different areas, including neo-gothic rooms, bordello-chic decor, and a rooftop terrace with a glass enclosure and garden.
The Grand Hyatt Hotel has a grand and beautiful lobby, with mirrored surfaces and a huge fountain. Reviewers mentioned that it is a very grand building.

The Greenwich Hotel has a unique, European-inspired design with eclectic, individually decorated rooms that have high ceilings and hardwood floors. The hotel incorporates elements reminiscent of an Italian villa or Swiss chalet, featuring a courtyard, drawing room, and a Japanese-style pool.
The Hampton Inn is a new or recently renovated hotel with modern rooms and decor. Some reviewers noted the building used to be a parking garage.
This Hampton Inn is described as a small, vertical hotel with a minimalist chic lobby. The hotel has 19 floors and 8 rooms per floor, in a narrow building.
The Hampton Inn Chelsea is a newly constructed 20-story high rise with a contemporary decor. The lobby is modern, and the rooms feature modern decor.

The Hampton Inn Soho has a modern, industrial-chic design with exposed beams in the lobby, and a greenhouse with a stream and Buddha head. The hotel has an upscale theme, with artwork on the corridors, metallic paint on the doors, and a silver lobby with high arches and pendant lighting.
The hotel is a narrow high-rise building with 30+ stories and only six rooms per floor. It is situated next to two other hotels.

The Hampton Inn is in a historic building and has rooms strategically situated to accommodate only 8 rooms per floor. The hotel is designed to look like it has been there a while due to NYC code requirements.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older hotel with "old world charm", large rooms, and a small lobby, with some rooms offering views of the Chrysler Building. Some reviews note the hotel is dated and in need of renovation.

The Hilton Club is a hotel-within-a-hotel located on the 37th and 38th floor of The Hilton, with suites that have built in furnishings and glass-walled showers. It is located in midtown, near Rockefeller Center, Radio City Hall, Broadway, and Times Square.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is described as a tall and thin building with a small lobby featuring a water feature, and modern, business-oriented decor. Some reviewers mention upper floors having views of the Empire State Building.
The Hilton Garden Inn is described as a narrow, tall building that is only five rooms wide on the street front. It is a new, modern hotel that opened in February or March 2009.
The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square occupies a renovated motor lodge featuring black and white portraits of New York City throughout. Some reviewers suggest it is designed like a boutique hotel.
The hotel is described as a new building with a contemporary feel in the lobby and rooms that are clean and stylish. Some reviewers note that it's not an opulent or over-the-top hotel.

The Hilton New York is a modern, huge hotel with nearly 2000 rooms, and features newly renovated rooms with sleek, built-in furniture, large LCD-screen TVs, and modern bathrooms with walk-in showers. The lobby is large and busy, sometimes described as bustling, and the hotel has a very present 'eighties' vibe.

The Hilton Times Square has a modest entrance, and the lobby is located on the 21st floor, requiring an elevator ride from street level. The hotel's rooms start on the 23rd floor and go up to the 44th floor.
This Holiday Inn Express is in a tall, narrow building with 6 rooms per floor, and the rooms are modern and renovated. There is no on-site restaurant or grand lobby.
I am sorry, but there is nothing about the architecture or design that can be extracted from the reviews about this hotel. Most of the reviews focus on the location and cleanliness of the rooms.

This Holiday Inn Express is a new or recently renovated 15-story building with modern decor, but reviews do not mention unique architectural design. Some rooms have a whirlpool tub with a glass wall separating the bathroom from the main room.

The hotel is described as a converted building, with small and cramped rooms, which may be due to the building's original design. Some reviewers mention outdated decor, suggesting that it doesn't have a unique or modern architectural design.

The Holiday Inn Midtown is described as a basic hotel, with older decor that could use some renovation, though some rooms may be renovated. The hotel consists of two towers, offering views of the city from upper floors and a rooftop pool.
The Holiday Inn is a slender, 25 story building with 10 rooms per floor that was built from the ground up and finished in June 2008. It is a new, modern, and clean hotel with small elevators.

Hotel 17 has a European style with dark wood trim, quirky decor, and antique furnishings. The building has a 1920s feel with a charming, renovated lobby, an old wood-paneled elevator, and mismatched wallpaper in some rooms.

Hotel 31 is an old-fashioned, traditional New York-style budget hotel with a retro feel, high ceilings, and wood moldings, featuring a small, old elevator with a metal gate. The building's design gives it a film noir, cinematographic style, with different colored wallpapers and old furnishings.

Hotel 373 is a small, modern, and clean boutique hotel that some reviewers have noted used to be an office building. The hotel has a small lobby, narrow corridors, and small rooms with marble bathrooms.
Hotel 41 is a trendy, small boutique hotel with a hip, clean, and modern feel, and stylish rooms, decorated with a retro design. Some rooms feature a penthouse suite with terraces.

The hotel features rooms decorated in a modern style, with large LCD TVs and bathrooms that have showers and bathtubs closed by glass doors, some with intricate stonework on the walls. The hotel was still under construction during the time of these reviews.
The Beacon Hotel is an older-style building with renovated rooms and an art deco style. Some rooms have views of the Ansonia Building across the street.

Hotel Chandler is a boutique-style hotel with an art deco building, a wrought iron staircase, and rooms decorated with a 20s style design, nice woods, and marble accents. Bathrooms feature blue tiling, a large tiled shower, and rainfall showerheads.
Hotel Deauville is described as a traditional brownstone hotel with an "Old World" feel, featuring a manual operated lift (elevator). Some rooms have purple bathrooms and older fixtures.

The East Houston hotel features a modern, minimalist design with dark wood, cherry wood floors, and a textured glass wall separating the bathroom from the bedroom. It has flock wallpaper in the style favored by boutique hotel proprietors and a rooftop terrace with city views.

Hotel Elysee is a small, European-style boutique hotel with unique rooms, French decor, antique furnishings, and vintage wall paintings. The hotel has one efficient elevator, a small intimate lobby, and a club room with a living room-style common room above the lobby.

Hotel Gansevoort has a trendy and modern design with sleek rooms, unique lighting, flat screen TVs, a rooftop bar and pool, and spacious rooms by NYC standards. It is described as an architectural gem with contemporary art.
The Hotel Giraffe is a newer construction with an art deco design that features architecturally detailed rooms and glass pocket doors. Rooms feature a Juliet balcony and a wave glass pocket door.

Hotel Grand Union is described as a basic, older, and converted apartment building with dated decor, a small lift, small rooms, small bathrooms, and worn bedding, but some rooms have been recently renovated. The hotel is not luxurious and is primarily intended as a place to sleep.

The Hotel Indigo features a modern, minimalist interior design with spacious rooms, Aveda toiletries, and HD TVs. Some found the design "skimpy" and lacking amenities, while others appreciated its modern aesthetic.

Hotel Mela is a small, modern, chic, boutique hotel with contemporary décor and stylish, well-appointed rooms;
some reviews mention the lobby has a modern crimson design with a chess board and other games.
The Hotel Metro has a 1950's art deco theme, an Old Hollywood theme with film posters, and a 1920's style with Sinatra era music. The hotel's decor is described as boutique, trendy, and renovated.

The Hotel Newton is described as an older building, potentially a converted apartment, with wrought iron stairways and a lobby that has been recently redone. Some rooms have been renovated with spiffy, clean kitchens and bathrooms, but some rooms are dated and small.

The Hotel on Rivington features unique architecture with a voyeuristic facade, floor-to-ceiling windows, and glass-tiled bathrooms. Some rooms have features like Japanese soaking tubs or glass-walled showers with city views.
The Hotel Reserve is located in a converted office building, is newly opened, and has a modern design. Some reviewers describe the hotel as a typical boutique hotel with a small lobby.

The St. James Hotel is an old hotel with a retro feel, marble staircases, and some rooms that include an old fireplace and mantel; it is undergoing renovations with upgraded rooms, but some reviewers found it worn or tired. Some reviewers note that it is an old building which may result in noise issues, small elevators, small rooms, and a lack of amenities.

The Hotel Stanford has a lobby with a 20s art deco feel, and maintains some of its old features such as an elevator operated by a handle. Some rooms have been renovated with granite floors and tile showers, while others have dated decor and furniture.

Hotel Wales is described as a quaint, old-world hotel with distinctive architectural details, carved wooden furniture, and original woodwork. The hotel has a rooftop terrace with views of Central Park and the reservoir.

The Hudson Hotel has a unique architectural design including curved brick corners with brass statuettes, an impressive exposed brick lobby, a secret garden terrace, and guestroom hallways that are dimly lit. The hotel rooms are small, but stylishly designed with features such as wood-paneled walls and a skylit, ivy-covered roof.

The Ink48 has a modern, sleek design with large windows offering city and river views, and unique features like a wall of shoeshine bristles in the elevators. Rooms have interesting layouts with floor-to-ceiling windows, funky lighting fixtures, and spacious bathrooms with sand brickwork showers.

The Inn New York City is located in a converted brownstone with unique architectural details and decor, including antiques, stained glass, and fireplaces. Each suite is individually decorated and has a different theme.

The Barclay Intercontinental is an old hotel with historical charm, a grand lobby, and a beautiful lobby but some reviewers note that it is old-fashioned and tired in places. It is located in midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, and other mid-town attractions.

The Jumeirah Essex House is located in a historical art deco building with photos of New York throughout its history in the lobby. The hotel has been renovated and includes features like automatic lighting and touch screen telephones.
The Kitano is a Japanese-themed boutique hotel with traditional Japanese accents throughout. It features a Botero fat cat sculpture in the lobby and has a Japanese restaurant on site.

The La Quinta Manhattan is located in an older building, and some reviewers note its small size and need for updating. It is a historical landmark and has a rooftop bar that offers views of the Empire State Building.

Lafayette House is a 15-room townhouse-style boutique hotel in an old 1848 building decorated with antiques and victorian style furnishings. Rooms feature sitting areas with fireplaces and some have kitchenettes and access to a courtyard garden.

Le Parker Meridien features a modern, Bauhaus-style interior with cartoons in the elevators and a roof-top pool, though some reviewers found the style sterile and sterile. Some rooms have unique features like a swiveling entertainment center.

The Library Hotel has an innovative library theme, and each room is themed based on the dewey decimal system with a collection of books and elegant decor. The hotel's architecture has prewar, Art Deco elements, along with a lively bar on the penthouse floor and an upscale bistro on the ground floor.

The Loews Regency is described as an old-school property with nicely preserved historical touches in the public spaces. Some reviews mention that the hotel rooms are dated and in need of refurbishment.
The Lowell is located in an old apartment building with small elevators. It is a small, intimate, European-style hotel with a tiny lobby.
The Mandarin Oriental is located in the Time Warner Center and occupies the 35th floor and up, offering views of Central Park and the Hudson River. Its design is modern with an Asian touch.

The Milford Plaza is a 1920s-era hotel with a design reminiscent of that time, but some reviewers note that it is currently undergoing renovations and could use updating. The hotel is also described as a BIG hotel with a lot of rooms and notes on the elevator system.

The Millenium Hilton has a modern and original architecture and is a very tall (53 levels), narrow, glass-walled building. Rooms are decorated in a contemporary, minimalist style and many rooms offer views of the Hudson River and/or the Brooklyn Bridge.
The Millennium Broadway has a dark marble lobby with classic art deco New York architecture. Its exterior is modern yet unique.

The Millennium UN Plaza features modern decor, a mirrored lobby, and framed Asian textiles as wall decorations. The building has two towers and provides views of the East River, the United Nations, and the Manhattan skyline.

The Moderne Hotel is a small, 37-room boutique hotel with retro decor, including Andy Warhol-themed rooms featuring Marilyn Monroe pictures and silver leather headboards. Some reviewers mention the hotel's minimalistic design, funky bathrooms, and low-to-the-ground beds.

Morgans Hotel has a modern, black and white theme throughout, with a checkerboard display on the lobby ceiling. Some rooms have unique designs like open showers, spire-like ceilings, and window-ledge seating, with views of the Empire State Building.

This hotel is a renovated apartment building with spacious suites including full kitchens, dining and living areas. The hotel's architecture and decor are described as dated, with furnishings reminiscent of the 1970s and 80s.

The Murray Hill Inn is described as being in a brownstone-type building with a European flavor and a quaint, old style. Some reviewers describe the rooms as quirky with no frills, while others mention recent remodeling.

The Marriott Downtown is a typical narrow Manhattan high-rise with clean, modern rooms, some offering views of the Hudson River and Statue of Liberty. Some reviewers mention a stained glass light in the lobby.

The Marriott East Side is described as an older or historic building, originally built around 1924, with vintage woods and brass in the lobby. Some reviewers mention design upgrades in rooms, while others note the small, cramped elevators reflecting the building's age.

The Marriott Marquis has a unique, modern architectural design with a soaring atrium, glass elevators, and a revolving restaurant on the top floor, offering panoramic city views. The hotel's design is often described as a microcosm of New York, exciting, vibrant, immense, and bold.

The New York Palace is described as having a combination of old-world opulence and modern amenities, with a beautiful lobby, grand staircase, and a courtyard featuring a mix of Renaissance-revival gilding and frescoes. The hotel consists of a modern hotel tower built in 1980 above the historic 19th-century brownstone Villard mansions.

The Night Hotel has a "gothic" black and white theme, is decorated in art deco style, and has erotic photography displayed. The rooms are small and have a modern design with small LCD screens displaying room numbers.

The hotel lobby is located on the 7th floor, accessible by elevator, and offers a modernly decorated space with a terrace overlooking Times Square. Reviews mention a beautiful balcony with excellent views of Times Square, with Café Nicole restaurant on the 7th floor having an amazing view.
The hotel is described as being in reconditioned apartments with a lobby featuring signed testimonials by musicians. It is also mentioned to look a bit like an 80's casino from the outside.
The Omni Berkshire Place has a European-style design, marble features and is in an older building. One reviewer noted a preference against the dated decor with ceiling cornice, brass and small lifts.

On the Ave features sleek, minimalist decor in its rooms, as well as a 16th-floor terrace with city views. Some rooms have balconies with Hudson River views, and the hotel's architecture is turn-of-the-century.

Park 79 is located in an old building, formerly a house; it is an older building with pre-war moldings and fixtures and original wood floors in the hallways, and inlaid wood floors (torn up in some spots). Sleek and modern styles may not appeal to guests; renovations of the lobby are planned.

The Park Central Hotel is described as an older, mansion-block style hotel, with stone facade at the entrance, but rooms are described as old style, outdated, and in need of renovation. The lobby and bar areas, however, have been updated nicely and have a nice atmosphere.
The Park South Hotel has an art deco style and the hotel is in an older building. The hallways on some floors have many windows, and the hotel has been newly renovated.

The Peninsula is located in a historic Beaux Arts building with a lobby and bars that maintain an Edwardian look and feel. The spa and pool are on floors 21 to 23 and have been added onto the top of the original hotel.
The Phillips Club features a lobby that some guests found stunning and offers stylish, modern suites with attractive lighting. Some reviewers mention that the building is a mix of hotel and condo.

The Plaza Athenee has a European, residential feel and is decorated with French furniture and Murano glass chandeliers. Some reviewers found it dated in some aspects while others found it luxurious and charming.
The Radisson Martinique is an older building with character, and a Renaissance staircase is mentioned. The hotel had marble details, but is described as tired looking and in need of a facelift.

The Ramada Eastside is in an older building with classic architecture and a retro vibe, located in a residential neighborhood of Midtown Manhattan. Some rooms have been renovated with contemporary designs and include features like flat screen TVs and iPod docking stations.
The Red Roof Inn is described as a converted office building that is being maintained very well with a smart conversion. Many reviewers mention a basic, clean, and modern room design.

Hotel 57 is a boutique hotel with a sleek and modern decor, a European feel, frosted glass pocket doors for the bathroom, and artistic glass. The hotel's design includes a small lobby with kiosks for check-in, leading to elevators to the main lobby and rooms.

The Renaissance Times Square features modern and futuristic decor with an X theme, inspired by its location at the intersection of Broadway and 7th Avenue. Reviews mention unique sculptures, chairs, railings, and accents throughout the hotel, as well as interesting, modern sculptural details that look very anatomical.
The hotel has a new building and the lobby has a waterfall. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, or Bryant Park.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park has a stylish, rich Art Deco fashion, picking up design cues from ocean liners such as the Normandie. Decor is elegantly styled, with dark woods and muted colors with comfortable furnishings, and was renovated to have a contemporary style with the lower floors/common rooms having art deco decor.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel is described as a modern hotel built in 2006 with a boutique feel, featuring self-service check-in kiosks and modern room furnishings including flat-screen TVs. The hotel also has a 7th-floor Terrace Club with a spacious sitting area and a restaurant.

The Roger Smith Hotel is a boutique hotel with unique accents that make each room distinct, featuring unique decor, art, and books; some rooms have a kitchenette. The hotel has a gallery showcasing innovative art, metalwork, and murals throughout the building.
The Roger Williams Hotel is a trendy boutique hotel with a modern, colorful decor, and has been recently renovated. Some rooms have terraces with views of the Empire State Building.
This hotel has a retro-modern decor, funky communal areas, unique showers, dim lighting, and a pool in the lobby with a swim-up bar and sauna. The design is European style with clean lines.

The Royalton Hotel has a hip, trendy, Philippe Stark design with a dark, moody atmosphere, narrow hallways and small elevators; the hotel's lobby has been recently renovated with a funky fireplace. Rooms feature unique round bathtubs, mirrored mosaic tiles, candles, lighted cubbies and dimmable lights to create a romantic and chic ambiance.

The Salisbury Hotel is an older hotel with architecture dating back to 1939 and rooms that are described as plain and old-fashioned, with decor from past decades like the 70s. Some reviewers mention that the exterior, reception, and hallways are quite plain.

The San Carlos is described as a renovated apartment building with mixed results, with a drab beige decor. Some reviewers note the hotel has an Art Deco lobby, while others describe it as a typical boutique hotel.
I am sorry, the reviews do not contain information about the architectural design of the hotel. The reviews mention that the hotel is basic, clean, and simple.

This hotel is a large, older property with a recently renovated lobby. Some reviewers note worn carpets, outdated bathrooms, and small rooms, while others highlight comfortable beds and large flat-screen TVs.
The Skyline Hotel has an art deco-style lobby and is described as having an old-fashioned decor throughout, dating back to the 1950s. The hotel is a low-rise building, which is unusual in Manhattan.

The Smyth Tribeca is a modern, minimalist hotel with rooms featuring floor-to-ceiling windows, marble bathrooms, and frosted glass walls separating the bathroom from the bedroom. Some rooms have open-plan bathrooms with showers enclosed on one side with slightly frosted glass, while others have enclosed showers with doors.
The Sofitel New York has an art-deco lobby and Edwardian facade, with a French-influenced bar area and a marble-floored lobby and lounge. Its decor is on the edge of opulent, with a 1930s feel.

The Soho Grand Hotel has a neo-19th century industrial chic design, with common spaces including a Gotham City-esque dimly lit interior, metal staircases, a lounge, and a bar. Some reviewers describe the hotel as having a unique architectural style, vintage touches, and an industrial theme.

Soho House New York features a unique architectural design with spacious, individually decorated rooms furnished with vintage and modern pieces, as well as warehouse-style living spaces. The hotel also includes a rooftop pool and bar with views of the city.

The Stay Hotel has a trendy lobby with funky lighting and a large floor-to-ceiling fish tank; the Aspen Social Club is designed like a Montana lodge. The hotel is newly renovated with a modern, boutique style.
The Alex Hotel is a modern, minimalist boutique hotel with contemporary flair and Japanese vibe rooms. Some rooms offer spectacular views of the Chrysler building and other skyscrapers.

The Belvedere Hotel has an Art Deco style lobby and some rooms are newly renovated with marble bathrooms. Some reviewers describe it as an older hotel, and the architectural design is not heavily emphasized.

The Benjamin is a Beaux Arts style boutique hotel with a charming lobby; it is located in a renovated apartment building with a mezzanine level above the registration area. Some rooms at the Benjamin have balconies and/or corner suite views.

The Blakely Hotel remains a building from a previous era and has an old world feel with dark wood playing a large feature in its style. The hotel is small with a small boutique feeling and has Tray ceilings, crown molding, and British Colonial decor.

The Bowery Hotel has a unique architectural design with an old British touch, floor-to-ceiling windows, and rooms that blend traditional elements with contemporary flair, creating an authentic, old NYC style. It features a vintage look with wooden panelled walls, age-darkened mirrors, and exposed brick.

The Bryant Park Hotel is housed in a 1924 Art Deco skyscraper with black volcanic colored walls and gold trimmings on its gothic-style rooftop. It is a modern boutique hotel with a trendy, dimly lit red lobby and elevators, and modern, minimalist room decor.

The Carlton Hotel has an impressive lobby with an Edwardian-style bar and includes features like a Tiffany skylight and a two-story waterfall with an old-time photo of NY behind it. Some reviewers mention art deco and modern design present throughout the hotel.

The Carlyle is an old-school, classy, and classic luxury hotel with an art deco lobby and a residential feel, with some rooms featuring hardwood floors and unique layouts. The hotel, opened in 1930, retains much of its original atmosphere, including elevator operators.

The Franklin Hotel is a small, European-style boutique hotel built around 1920, featuring an old-fashioned elevator, antique furnishings, and chandeliers. Rooms are small but well-appointed with modern touches and unique decor.
The French Quarters Guest Apartments has a charming, European-esque structure with rooms decorated in a French Orleans style. The hotel is described as stylishly decorated with elegant rooms.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea has a modern, boutique-style design with rooms decorated in an "Ikea" style, featuring black, red, and gray interiors, and spotlit orchids on upper floors. The hotel aims for a clean and chic look with bright white walls, furniture, linens, and bathroom subway tiles.

The hotel has a "Zen minimalism" style with modern, stylish, and minimalist decor, featuring black and white color schemes with red accents. Rooms are newly renovated with flat-screen TVs and stylish bathrooms.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not contain information about hotels with a unique architectural design.
The Grant Hotel is located in an old building, with a small elevator, and some rooms have windows facing brick walls. Renovations have been done, and some floors are being renovated.
This Hampton Inn has been renovated and features modern decor. The hotel lobby is bright.
The Helmsley Carlton House is located one block from Central Park and offers spacious rooms, including junior suites with kitchenettes. Some rooms have balconies overlooking Central Park.

The Helmsley Park Lane features old-style glamorous decor, often described as dated or reminiscent of the 70s and 80s, with elements like mirrored ceilings, worn carpets, and antique furniture. Some reviewers found the decor "kitsch" or "gaudy," while others appreciated its classic charm.

Herald Square Hotel is in a building with period hardware, period bathrooms, quaint posters, and Life Magazine art gallery on the walls. It has period hardware in the bathrooms and is the old Life Magazine building.

Hotel 91 features modern decor with Asian accents, though some reviewers find the lobby decor to be shabby or strange, and the building has vacant retail spaces on the ground floor. The hotel is described as minimalist in design.
The Hotel at Times Square is in an old building with classic architecture, as evidenced by the uneven stairsteps and the stairways. The hotel lobby and rooms have been renovated with a modern design.

The Inn at Irving Place is located in an 1834 townhouse with authentic 19th-century decor and architecture. The hotel's design is described as a combination of two combined brownstones with antique furnishings, fireplaces, and period details like wood floors and open stairs.

The Iroquois is described as a classy, calm, good-looking boutique-style hotel with elegant decor, classic furnishings, and a cozy library; some rooms offer views of the Chrysler building. Reviews mention that the hotel building is old-style, intimate, and recently renovated, with cozy common areas and small rooms.

The Jane Hotel has a historic building with a vintage vibe, cabin-style rooms, wood decor, and a manually operated elevator. Its architecture is reminiscent of a ship, and the hotel sheltered Titanic survivors.

The Kimberly Hotel is an older, converted apartment building with traditional-style furnishings, and some suites feature balconies. Some reviewers found the decor dated, while others appreciated the spaciousness and apartment-like feel of the suites.

The Lombardy is a boutique hotel where each room is individually owned and decorated, resulting in different themes and styles. Rooms are either studios or one-bedroom apartments with kitchens, and decor is controlled centrally by hotel management and updated regularly.

The London NYC is a modern, stylish hotel with large, newly renovated rooms described as having a sleek, trendy design and spacious suites. Features include Waterworks-designed bathrooms, LCD TVs, and iPod docking stations.
The Lucerne Hotel is in a heritage building with traditional decor and European hotel ambiance.  Some rooms have been renovated in a French style.

The Manhattan Club is described as an older building that has been refurbished, with remodelled rooms that can be small. Some rooms face inward into a central shaft, letting in little light, so outward-facing rooms are recommended.

The Mansfield Hotel is a small, turn-of-the-century boutique hotel with a European feel, marble floors, and a library/lounge reminiscent of a gentleman's club. The hotel has been updated with some modern touches.

The Marcel at Gramercy is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with a minimalist, funky decor and some rooms with dual aspect views. Some rooms have zebra print decor, avant-garde decor, and stylishly designed bathrooms.

The Maritime Hotel has a unique nautical theme, with rooms designed like ship cabins featuring porthole windows. The hotel's architecture is inspired by a cruise ship, with dark wood paneling and a submarine-like atmosphere.

The Mark underwent a complete makeover with enormous, modern rooms; bathrooms feature marble, a deep soaking tub, and a TV in the mirror. Some rooms include a kitchenette and remote-controlled features like electric shades, LCD TV, and lighting.
The Marmara is a 32+ storey complex with a chandelier in the lift and a museum-quality lobby. It was recently transformed from an apartment building to a hotel.

The hotel has a modern style and is newly renovated, with a white and red decor in the lobby and hardwood floors in the rooms. The lobby's design combines South Beach white lines and NYC contemporary sharp edges.

The Mercer is a modern, chic, and understated boutique hotel with high ceilings, large rooms, open brickwork, large curved windows, structural columns, and minimalist decor. The building has a "end of the 19th century" style facade with metal fire stairs.

The Michelangelo Hotel has a beautiful lobby with a European, specifically Italian, old-world style, with a pink marble floor, marble bathrooms, and several styles of decor. Some rooms have neoclassical decor and some suites are appointed with artisan cheeses, fruit, and wine.
The Milburn Hotel is in an old apartment building and has been converted to a hotel, but some of the apartment features do show up in the rooms. Some reviewers note the building is a bit outdated.

The Muse Hotel is a trendy boutique hotel with modern art deco-themed rooms and uniquely decorated common areas, including creative yet comfy decor. The lobby features creative decorations, such as a video-projected fire and wine rack, with uniquely designed bathrooms.
Reviews mention that the hotel's lobby is old New York, swanky and dimly lit with decor from the 1980s. Some rooms offer views of the Chrysler or Empire State buildings.

The New Yorker Hotel is built in the Art Deco style, featuring a grand lobby, and has been recently refurbished while retaining some of its original architectural features. Rooms feature period Art Deco style fittings or decor.

The Pierre is an iconic hotel with old-world charm, featuring architectural details like a functional mail chute, an expansive marble lobby, and crown moldings throughout the building. The hotel has undergone recent renovations that maintain its classic style while incorporating contemporary elements.

The Plaza Hotel is a Beau-Arts landmark with architecture that has tried to recapture some of the original Plaza hotel, with features such as a lobby with a stained/leaded glass ceiling in the Palm Court. Rooms feature high ceilings, elegant architectural details, french windows, and bathrooms with mosaic tile and gold embossed wall designs.

The Pod Hotel has a funky, modern, and trendy architectural design with a colorful lobby, cozy atmosphere, and unique rooftop terrace. The rooms are designed to maximize space in small areas with features including stainless steel sinks, iPod docking stations, and interesting bathroom setups.

The Premier is described as a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, with a small and impersonal lobby that may resemble an office building hall rather than a luxury hotel. Rooms are modern and well-isolated from outside noise, with spacious bathrooms in some rooms.
The hotel has a traditional architectural style, with silk-upholstered walls and marble bathrooms. Rooms feature telescopes for viewing Central Park.

The Roosevelt Hotel is a grand, old hotel with a beautiful lobby that is known for its elegant, splendid, and classic old New York-style design; the hotel has a historic atmosphere with pre-war architecture and an over-the-top purple and green extravaganza. The hotel is described as charming, elegant, grand, and classic.

The Sherry-Netherland is noted for its unique, individually owned and decorated rooms/suites, offering a non-"big hotel" feel with spacious layouts and varied views, some overlooking Central Park or the Empire State Building. Its architecture is considered beautiful, featuring hand-painted elevator details and a sequestered, gilded lobby.

The Shoreham is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with a minimalist decor, chic lobby, and rooms featuring flat-screen TVs and Aveda products. Some rooms have stainless steel bathrooms, massage chairs, and penthouse suites with balconies.
The hotel has classical decor with old-school glamour and French neoclassical rooms. Some rooms have features like a flat-screen TV that appears from a pop-up box at the foot of the bed.

The Standard Hotel has a unique architectural design, constructed on concrete stilts with floor-to-ceiling windows offering great city views. It straddles the High Line, and the rooms feature stylish, modern decor.

The Surrey is noted for its elegant furnishings and decor, with rooms featuring hand-painted decals and dark wood tones. The hotel has a classically modern marble lobby with one-of-a-kind art pieces and timeless furniture.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in a historical townhouse on Sylvan Terrace, near the Jumel Mansion, the oldest house in Manhattan. The house features African art, a well-equipped kitchen, a terrace, luxury bathrooms, and a living room.

The Time Hotel is a modern, sophisticated boutique hotel with art deco styling, featuring rooms in red, blue, and yellow color schemes. The hotel has glass elevators to the second-floor lobby and hallways with seconds of a clock in Roman Numerals.
The Waldorf Astoria is a historic, opulent art deco hotel with a grand lobby, ballrooms, and displays showcasing its history. Its rooms feature a traditional style, and some offer city views.

The Westin New York at Times Square is a modern, 45-story glass tower with sleek interiors, and some rooms offer city and Hudson River views. Its decor is of a modern mid-century revival style, with some bathrooms having a stainless steel sink.
The Hotel Thirty Thirty features a hip, minimalist lobby design with sleek accommodations. Reviews mention a modern bathroom design, and spacious rooms in the superior category.

The Thompson LES features a modern, urban, and minimalist design with concrete, monochrome elements, floor-to-ceiling windows, and spacious rooms. It has a sleek, "industrial" decor with zebrawood furniture, hardwood floors, and a large flat TV screen.
The Travel Inn is described as a basic, older hotel that was likened to a motel, with many rooms opening onto a corridor by the pool. The hotel is not luxurious, with a dated decor.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy hotel with a unique open atrium design, industrial chic decor, subdued lighting, and a glass elevator. The hotel has a sleek, European styling, and rooms feature large picture windows.

The hotel is housed in a re-clad black monolith building, formerly the Gulf & Western Building, with interiors featuring subtle inferences of the Trump diamond logo. Rooms offer floor-to-ceiling windows with views of Central Park and cityscapes.

The Tudor Hotel is listed in the National Register of Historic Hotels, featuring an old brick building exterior and photos of old NY in the hallways. The hotel is part of the 1920s "Tudor City" development next to the UN.

The Vincci Avalon, while not particularly luxurious, has old furniture and a dated if clean style with opulent entrances, marble bathrooms, and "Georgian distressed elegance" decor. Some reviewers mention it is a "European style" building.

W The Court is located in an older building from the Doral Court era and has a boutique feel. The hotel maintains the character of the era in which the building was constructed and mixes it with a modern flair.

The W Tuscany is in a renovated older building, described by some as an old converted brownstone or an old apartment building, with modern, trendy, and chic decor. Some reviewers note the hotel's bathrooms and hallways feel old and are in need of renovation.

The W Times Square is a trendy and modern hotel with a cascading waterfall entranceway, sleek and dark interiors, and rooms featuring Bliss bath products and ipod docking stations. Many rooms offer great views of Times Square and the Hudson River.

The W Union Square occupies a historic building with elements of older construction, like tiled floors, and was converted from an insurance company building. Its design blends old architecture with more modern elements, and some rooms offer high ceilings.

The Waldorf Towers is located inside the historic Waldorf Astoria Hotel, has an Art Deco design, and features spacious rooms with architectural details. Some suites include marble foyers and bathrooms, dining rooms, and kitchenettes.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, boutique hotel with a charming interior design featuring a mix of colonial and turn-of-the-(20th)century era wallpapering and linens. It has a European feel, with stylish rooms and marble bathrooms.

The Warwick Hotel is a historic hotel with a classy architectural style, old-world charm, ornate decorative detailing, beautiful elevators, and murals painted for William Randolph Hearst. Reviewers mention it was built in the 1920s, retains a bit of the allure of that period, and reflects 1940s design.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is an old building with a small, elegant lobby and marble floors, with an elevator that is small and slow. Rooms are small and have been recently renovated with modern decor.

The Washington Square Hotel is a boutique hotel with an Art Deco style, located in a historic building near Washington Square Park. It features unique design elements like tile paintings and original art, and has a cozy, old New York feel.

The Wellington Hotel has an art deco design and has a lot of character and charm, with a historic, old-fashioned feel. However, some reviewers note that the building is old and tired and needs updating.

The HGVC West 57th Street has a modern and contemporary building design with artist drawings and a glass-windowed exercise room overlooking the street. Rooms feature hardwood floors and Italian marble shower stalls with glass walls.
This hotel is a rehabbed place with new bedding & carpeting, spacious bathrooms, and modern decor. The interior of the hotel is newly renovated and elegant, yet unpretentious.

The Wolcott Hotel is housed in a 100+ year old building with a Beaux-Arts lobby with opulent features such as chandeliers and a ballroom. The hotel's architecture is described as old school with some rooms offering views of the Empire State Building.
The building is described as almost 100 years old, with a plaque next to the entrance. Reviews mention it being next to the historical Ansonia building and typical of Central Park West architecture.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel Times Square South features a modern architectural design with a chic style, as well as a greenhouse-style restaurant with a garden-like atmosphere. The hotel is newly renovated with clean, well-designed rooms.
